qas.question: When was Maria Deraismes initiated into Freemasonry?

answers.text: allow her lodge to rejoin their Grand Lodge

context: <a5_0>Maria Deraismes<a5_0/> was initiated into Freemasonry in <a0_0><a6_0><b10_0>1882<b10_0/><a6_0/><a0_0/>, then resigned to <a1_0>allow her lodge to rejoin <b11_0>their Grand Lodge<b11_0/><a1_0/>. Having failed to achieve acceptance from any masonic governing body, she and <a3_0><a7_0><b13_0>Georges Martin<b13_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/> started a mixed masonic lodge that actually worked masonic ritual. <a4_0>Annie Besant<a4_0/> spread the phenomenon to the English speaking world. <a2_0><b12_0>Disagreements over ritual<b12_0/><a2_0/> led to the formation of exclusively female bodies of Freemasons in England, which spread to other countries. Meanwhile, the French had re-invented Adoption as an all-female lodge in <a8_0><b14_0>1901<b14_0/><a8_0/>, only to cast it aside again in <a9_0>1935<a9_0/>. The lodges, however, continued to meet, which gave rise, in 1959, to a body of women practising continental Freemasonry.
